indicatorName: Name of the outcome indicator- the overall goal we are trying to reach
proxyName: Name of the proxy - the measurable means to achieving the outcome
proxyDescription: Description of the proxy - helpful to the user for deciding which proxies they desire to use. This description should also comment on how the default value is measured
financialProxyValue: How much monetary value is achieved when one default quantity of our unit of the proxy is realized?
defaultQuantity: The quantity of the Unit of Measurement, for which we have the proxy value in the 'Proxy Value' column.
unitOfMeasurement:
What is the unit 
of measurement in 
which we can express 
our proxy? (in plural)
outcomeIntendedness: Whether this change (outcome), resulting from the described activity (project) is intended (expected) or unintendend (unexpected) by the stakeholder / project group?
outcomePolarity: Whether this change is positive (desired) or negative (undesired) for the stakeholder.
sourceUrl: Where and how did we obtain the data used for the valuation of the proxy and the pairing of the proxy to the indicator - if the study is made available (for free) online.
sourceCitation: Where and how did we obtain the data used for the valuation of the proxy and the pairing of the proxy to the indicator - if the study was published in a peer reviewed journal, article, or public document.
sourceCountry: In which country was the indicator-proxy pairing studied and proven (in the source)
sourceYear: When was the indicatory-proxy pairing studied (in the source)
defaultLeakage:
The proportion of 
outputs/outcomes 
that benefit 
those outside 
the target area 
of the intervention
defaultDeadweight:
The proportion of the total
output/outcome that
would have been secured
anyway - without
the project in question.
defaultAttribution:
An assessment of 
how much of the outcome 
was caused by the 
contribution of other 
organisations, people,
or projects other than the
one in question here.
defaultYearlyDropoff:
The yearly rate of Recidivism. 
What proportion of the indicator will be removed 
from the estimated yearly
qunatity in each subsequent 
year of the
defaultDisplacement:
The proportion of 
outputs/outcomes 
that are reduced 
elsewhere in the 
target area

proxyDescription: Paragraph
financialProxyValue: Monetary value in Euro (just the number without the â‚¬ sign)
defaultQuantity: Number (without sign for unit of measurement)
outcomeIntendedness:
Either 'Intended' 
or 
'Unintended'. Please be mindful of spelling.
outcomePolarity: Either 'Positive' or 'Negative'. Please be mindful of spelling.
sourceUrl: URL with preceding 'http://' or "https://". If not available, leave blank.
sourceCountry: Country of source in English nomenclature
defaultLeakage: Number percentage (0 to 100, without the % sign)
defaultDeadweight: Number percentage (0 to 100, without the % sign)
defaultAttribution: Number percentage (0 to 100, without the % sign)
defaultYearlyDropoff: Number percentage (0 to 100, without the % sign)
defaultDisplacement: Number percentage (0 to 100, without the % sign)

indicatorName:
Reduction in gang activity 
in the area
proxyDescription:
A (fictional) study has shown that there is
a direct correlation between gang activity 
and the amount of grafitti in the area.
It also quantifies that sanation of an average piece of grafitti (at least 50x50cm) 
costs 500 â‚¬.
sourceCitation: Lindley, J., & Coulton, P. (2016, May). Pushing the limits of design fiction: The case for fictional research papers. In Proceedings of the 2016 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (pp. 4032-4043).

proxyDescription: The social cost of carbon (SCC) is the marginal cost of the impacts caused by emitting one extra tonne of greenhouse gas (carbon dioxide equivalent) at any point in time, inclusive of 'non-market' impacts on the environment and human health.
